plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant with large, bright yellow flower heads that follow the sun's movement. Commonly cultivated but also found wild in fields across North America.
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism during early growth, turning to face the sun; mature flowers generally face east.

plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A hardy wildflower with vibrant yellow to orange ray florets and distinctive dark brown centers, often found in meadows and prairies.
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susans attract butterflies and other pollinators, making them valuable for natural gardens.

plants.name: Dahlia pinnata
plants.description: A tuberous-rooted plant known for its diverse and striking flower shapes and colors, widely cultivated in gardens.
plants.location: Native to Mexico and Central America, cultivated worldwide
plants.funFact: Dahlias are the national flower of Mexico and come in over 42 species with thousands of hybrids.

plants.name: Ginkgo biloba
plants.description: A unique deciduous tree species renowned for its fan-shaped leaves that turn bright yellow in autumn; female trees produce distinctive fruit that ripens around this time.
plants.bloomingSeason: Male flowers in spring; female fruit ripens in Septemberâ€“October
plants.location: Originally native to China; widely planted worldwide
plants.funFact: Ginkgo biloba is a living fossil, with fossils dating back 270 million years, and is resistant to pollution and disease.
